Vector Tiles for Leaflet 0.1 Installing GDAL Tools 0.2 Running GDAL Tools

Vector Tiles for Leaflet Shipeng Sun 2022-05-17 0.1 Installing GDAL Tools The GDAL tools are installed from https://www.gisinternals.com/. Rem Install the core with Python applications. Alternatively, it can be installed using OSGeo4W. However, OSGeo4W can interfere with PostgreSQL/PostGIS on GDAL for the setting. Therefore, it is not recommended to use OSGeo4W for GDAL. 0.1.1 GIS Internals By default, it is installed under C:\Program Files\GDAL. We can start with GDAL specified command terminal C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe /k "C:\Program Files\GDAL\GDALShell.bat" The Shell correctly set all the environmental variables in the terminal. This is how it avoids the conflicts with PostGIS and turns out to be a better option than OSGEO4W. 0.2 Running GDAL Tools 0.2.1 Show the database information with tables ogrinfo.exe PG:"host=localhost port=5432 dbname=nycod user=postgres password=postgres tables='ap,ap_census'" Show all the records in the table (don’t do this if the table is very big) ogrinfo.exe PG:"host=localhost port=5432 dbname=nycod user=postgres password=postgres" "rivers" 0.2.2 Try to export to MVT Change directory to the folder where you want to save the data. C:\Program Files\GDAL “This is the default GDAL folder” Change to the “working directory”: D:\Cloud_Drive\Dropbox (Hunter College)\Workspace\PythonPlayground\PySQL Rem TABLES open option of PostgreSQL/PostGIS controls what tables are included in the results. Rem By default, all tables with a geometry type of column will be exported. Rem dsco: data set creation options Rem leaflet.VectorGrid plugin cannot handle gzipped (Compressed) pbf ogr2ogr -f MVT nyc_census_boundary -overwrite PG:"host='localhost' port='5432' dbname='nycod' user='postgres' password='postgres' tables='ap,ap_census'" -dsco CONF="mvt.json" -dsco MAXZOOM=18 -dsco MINZOOM=14 -dsco COMPRESS=NO
